      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFacts(Collection<PositiveLiteral> facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addFacts(PositiveLiteral... facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addFactsFromDataSource(Predicate predicate, DataSource dataSource)
      Adds facts stored in given dataSource for given predicate to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void addRules(List<Rule> rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      void addRules(Rule... rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      QueryResultIterator answerQuery(PositiveLiteral query, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base: If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).
      CyclicityResult checkForCycles()
      Checks whether the loaded rules and loaded fact EDB predicates are Acyclic, Cyclic, or cyclicity cannot be determined.
      void close() 
      void exportQueryAnswersToCsv(PositiveLiteral query, String csvFilePath, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base, and writes its results the .csv file at given path csvFilePath: If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).

        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Sets the algorithm that will be used for reasoning over the knowledge base. If no algorithm is set, the default algorithm is Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE will be used.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithm to be used for reasoning.

      • setReasoningTimeout

        public void setReasoningTimeout(Integer seconds)
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        In some cases, reasoning with rules with existentially quantified variables Rule.getExistentiallyQuantifiedVariables() may not terminate. We recommend reasoning with algorithm Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE, as it leads to termination in more cases.
        This method sets a timeout (in seconds) after which reasoning can be artificially interrupted if it has not reached completion.
        Specified by:
        setReasoningTimeout in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        seconds - interval after which reasoning will be interrupted, in seconds. If null, reasoning will not be interrupted and will return only after (if) it has reached completion.

      • getReasoningTimeout

        public Integer getReasoningTimeout()
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        This method returns the reasoning timeout, representing the interval (in seconds) after which reasoning will be interrupted if it has not reached completion. The default value is null, in which case reasoning terminates only after (if) it reaches completion.
        Specified by:
        getReasoningTimeout in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        if not null, number of seconds after which the reasoning will be interrupted, if it has not reached completion.

        public void setRuleRewriteStrategy(RuleRewriteStrategy ruleRewritingStrategy)
                            throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Loaded Rules can be re-written internally to an equivalent set of rules, according to given ruleRewritingStrategy. If no staregy is set, the default value is RuleRewriteStrategy.NONE, meaning that the rules will not be re-written.
        Specified by:
        setRuleRewriteStrategy in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded.

      • addFacts

        public void addFacts(PositiveLiteral... facts)
              throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base. A fact is a PositiveLiteral with all terms (Literal.getTerms()) of type TermType.CONSTANT.
        Facts can only be added before loading (Reasoner.load()).
        Facts predicates (Literal.getPredicate()) cannot have multiple data sources.
        Specified by:
        addFacts in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        facts - facts to be added to the knowledge base. The given order is not maintained.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded (Reasoner.load()).

      • addFactsFromDataSource

        public void addFactsFromDataSource(Predicate predicate,
                                   DataSource dataSource)
                            throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Adds facts stored in given dataSource for given predicate to the reasoner knowledge base. Facts predicates cannot have multiple data sources, including in-memory Atom objects added trough Reasoner.addFacts(org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.model.api.PositiveLiteral...).
        Specified by:
        addFactsFromDataSource in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        predicate - the Predicate for which the given dataSource contains fact terms.
        dataSource - data source containing the fact terms to be associated to given predicate and added to the reasoner
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the reasoner has already been loaded (Reasoner.load()).

      • load

        public void load()
          throws EdbIdbSeparationException,
                 IOException,
                 IncompatiblePredicateArityException,
                 ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Loads the knowledge base, consisting of the current rules and facts, into the reasoner (if it has not been loaded yet). If the reasoner has already been loaded, this call does nothing. After loading, the reasoner is ready for reasoning and querying.
        Loading pre-condition: the Predicates appearing in Rule heads (Rule.getHead()), called IDB predicates, cannot also appear in knowledge base facts, called EDB predicates. An EdbIdbSeparationException would be thrown in this case.
        Specified by:
        load in interface Reasoner
        Throws:
        EdbIdbSeparationException - if a Predicate appearing in a Rule head (IDB predicate) also appears in a knowledge base fact (EDB predicate).
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs related to the resources in the knowledge base to be loaded.
        IncompatiblePredicateArityException - if the arity of a Predicate of a fact loaded from a data source (Reasoner.addFactsFromDataSource(Predicate, DataSource)) does nor match the arity of the facts in the corresponding data source.
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • reason

        public boolean reason()
               throws IOException,
                      ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Performs reasoning on the loaded knowledge base, depending on the set Algorithm. Reasoning implies extending the set of explicit facts in the knowledge base with implicit facts inferred by knowledge base rules.

        In some cases, reasoning with rules with existentially quantified variables Rule.getExistentiallyQuantifiedVariables() may not terminate. We recommend reasoning with algorithm Algorithm.RESTRICTED_CHASE, as it leads to termination in more cases.
        To avoid non-termination, a reasoning timeout can be set (Reasoner.setReasoningTimeout(Integer)).

        Incremental reasoning is not supported. To add more facts and rule to the knowledge base and reason again, the reasoner needs to be reset (Reasoner.resetReasoner()) to the state of its knowledge base before loading. Then, more information can be added to the knowledge base, the reasoner can be loaded again, and querying and reasoning can be performed.
        Specified by:
        reason in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        • the value returned by the previous Reasoner.reason() call, if successive reasoning is attempted before a Reasoner.resetReasoner().
        • true, if reasoning reached completion.
        • false, if reasoning has been interrupted before completion.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O exceptions occur during reasoning.
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (Reasoner.load() or after closing (Reasoner.close()).

      • answerQuery

        public QueryResultIterator answerQuery(PositiveLiteral query,
                                       boolean includeBlanks)
                                throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base:
        • If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts.
        • Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.

        An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK). The same variable name identifies the same term in the answer fact.
        A query answer is represented by a QueryResult. A query can have multiple, distinct query answers. This method returns an Iterator over these answers.
        Specified by:
        answerQuery in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        query - a PositiveLiteral representing the query to be answered.
        includeBlanks - if true, facts containing terms of type TermType.BLANK (representing anonymous individuals introduced to satisfy rule existentially quantified variables) will be included into the query results. Otherwise, the query results will only contain the facts with terms of type TermType.CONSTANT (representing named individuals).
        Returns:
        an AutoCloseable iterator for QueryResults, representing distinct answers to the query.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (Reasoner.load() or after closing (Reasoner.close()).

      • exportQueryAnswersToCsv

        public void exportQueryAnswersToCsv(PositiveLiteral query,
                                    String csvFilePath,
                                    boolean includeBlanks)
                             throws ReasonerStateException,
                                    IOException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base, and writes its results the .csv file at given path csvFilePath:
        • If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts.
        • Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.

        An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK). The same variable name identifies the same term in the answer fact.
        A query answer is represented by a QueryResult. A query can have multiple, distinct query answers.
        Specified by:
        exportQueryAnswersToCsv in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        query - a PositiveLiteral representing the query to be answered.
        csvFilePath - path to a .csv file where the query answers will be written. Each line of the .csv file represents a query answer fact, and it will contain the fact term names as columns.
        includeBlanks - if true, facts containing terms of type TermType.BLANK (representing anonymous individuals introduced to satisfy rule existentially quantified variables) will be included into the query answers. Otherwise, the query answers will only contain the facts with terms of type TermType.CONSTANT (representing named individuals).
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if this method is called before loading (Reasoner.load() or after closing (Reasoner.close()).
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs regarding given file (csvFilePath).

      • resetReasoner

        public void resetReasoner()
                   throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Resets the reasoner to a pre-loading state (before the call of Reasoner.load() method). All facts inferred by reasoning are discarded. Rules and facts added to the reasoner need to be loaded again, to be able to perform querying and reasoning.
        Specified by:
        resetReasoner in interface Reasoner
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • setLogFile

        public void setLogFile(String filePath)
                throws ReasonerStateException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Redirects the logs of the internal VLog C++ resource to given file. If no log file is set or the given filePath is not a valid file path, VLog will log to the default system output.
        Specified by:
        setLogFile in interface Reasoner
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file for the internal VLog C++ resource to log to. If null or an invalid file path, the reasoner will log to the default system output.
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException - if the method is called on a closed reasoner.

      • isJA

        public boolean isJA()
             throws ReasonerStateException,
                    karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Check the Joint Acyclicity (JA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is JA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Skolem chase (and, implicitly, the Restricted chase) will always terminate
        Specified by:
        isJA in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Joint Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isRJA

        public boolean isRJA()
              throws ReasonerStateException,
                     karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Check the Restricted Joint Acyclicity (RJA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RJA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Restricted chase will always terminate
        Specified by:
        isRJA in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Restricted Joint Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isMFA

        public boolean isMFA()
              throws ReasonerStateException,
                     karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Check the Model-Faithful Acyclicity (MFA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Skolem chase (and, implicitly, the Restricted chase) will always terminate
        Specified by:
        isMFA in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Model-Faithful Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isRMFA

        public boolean isRMFA()
               throws ReasonerStateException,
                      karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Check the Restricted Model-Faithful Acyclicity (RMFA) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RMFA, then, for the given set of rules and any facts over the given EDB predicates, reasoning by Restricted chase will always terminate. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFA, then it is also JA.
        Specified by:
        isRMFA in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Restricted Model-Faithful Acyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

      • isMFC

        public boolean isMFC()
              throws ReasonerStateException,
                     karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Check the Model-Faithful Cyclicity (MFC) property of loaded rules and EDB predicates of loaded facts. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is MFC, then there exists a set of facts over the given EDB predicates for which reasoning by Skolem chase algorithm is guaranteed not to terminate for the loaded rules. If a set of rules and EDB predicates is RMFA, then it is also RJA. Therefore, if a set or rules and EDB predicates is MFC, it is not MFA, nor JA.
        Specified by:
        isMFC in interface Reasoner
        Returns:
        true, if the loaded set of rules is Model-Faithful Cyclic with respect to the EDB predicates of loaded facts.
        false, otherwise
        Throws:
        ReasonerStateException
        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException

        public CyclicityResult checkForCycles()
                               throws ReasonerStateException,
                                      karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
        Description copied from interface: Reasoner
        Checks whether the loaded rules and loaded fact EDB predicates are Acyclic, Cyclic, or cyclicity cannot be determined.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Throws:

        karmaresearch.vlog.NotStartedException
